thread.title: La. Fire Marshal issues burn ban for entire state
thread.title_full: La. Fire Marshal issues burn ban for entire state - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Sam Winstrom, Assignment Editor
title: La. Fire Marshal issues burn ban for entire state
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - The Louisiana State Fire Marshal issued a burn ban for the entire state due to extremely dry conditions.
The Fire Marshal, along with the Department of Agriculture and Forestry, has issued a cease and desist order for all private burning. Private burning shall only be allowed by the permission of local fire departments or local government.
The order is effective as of 6 a.m. on Oct. 16 and shall remain in effect until lifted.
The state-wide ban is in response to extremely dry conditions, abnormal emergency responses and adverse future weather predictions according to the Fire Marshal.
This ban does not apply to prescribed burns by the Department of Agriculture and Forestry, by those trained and certified by the Department of Agriculture and Forestry or by those who conduct prescribed burning as a “generally accepted agriculture practice” as defined by the Louisiana Right to Farm Law.
Violation of the burn ban could result in criminal or civil penalties.
